channel.title: Projects on Wesley Tian
channel.description: Recent content in Projects on Wesley Tian

item.title: Saving Lives with Machine Learning
item.description: Summary: Work in progress. More updates coming soon!

item.title: Deep Learning with Residual Blocks
item.description: Summary: Lead team of undergraduate and graduate students to replicate results of the Deep Residual Learning for Image Recognition research paper. https://arxiv.org/pdf/1512.03385.pdf More updates coming soon!

item.title: My Own Cryptocurrency
item.description: Overview: Cryptocurrency built in Selenium on the Ethereum blockchain. GitHub Repo: https://github.com/wesleytian/WesTCoin

item.title: My First Machine Learning Competition
item.description: More updates coming soon! Summary: https://sites.google.com/view/assistmentsdatamining/home?authuser=0 Placed 3rd out of 74 research teams. Technologies: Python The first place winning team of Chun Kit Yeung, Kai Yang, and Dit-yan Yeung is from the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology. They used a state-of- the-art “Deep Knowledge Tracing” model to predict student performance, combined with boosting algorithms. Prof. Yeung said, “It was great to participate in this challenge and to be recognized.

item.title: Presenting to 3 Senior Vice Presidents of Fidelity Investments
item.description: More updates coming soon! Summary: Helped build an internal interviewer-interviewee scheduler. 6 internal teams competed. Won an $100 Amazon Gift Card.

item.title: My First AI
item.description: Summary: Command line AI that uses your play history to predict your next move in a game of Rock, Paper, Scissors. Uses the Bayes Rule. CMPSCI 383 Artificial Intelligence class final project at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst. Technologies: Java While game theorists showed that everyone playing the game rationally should play as randomly as possible (select paper, rock, and scissors each with 1⁄3 probability), people are terrible random number generators.

item.title: I Won $2000
item.description: More updates coming soon! Summary: Submitted to Hamp Hack 2017 Won most creative use of Indico API Awarded $2000/team member in API credits Devpost: https://devpost.com/software/fashion-filtr

item.title: Baby Tracker
item.description: More updates coming soon! Summary: Parse Baby Berk’s Twitter feed to gather current location of the food truck and display it on a map. Teammates: Phillip Michalowski and Nischal Tamang

item.title: A CSP Parser for AISpace
item.description: Summary: This script turns a CSV file into a XML file that can be imported into AIspace’s Consistency Based CSP Solver. Built using Python. The Consistency Based CSP Solver: http://www.aispace.org/downloads.shtml GitHub Repo: https://github.com/wesleytian/csv-xml-csp More updates coming soon!
